Confirmation from the Palm Beach County: Wendy Sartory Link, the Palm Beach County Supervisor of Elections, confirmed that Donald Trump did not vote twice in the November 3, 2020 election.
Verification of Trump: s voting history: It was verified that Trump had voted by mail for the presidential preference primary in March and the state primary in August, as allowed under Florida law.
Reports from news outlets: News outlets, including the Miami Herald, the Wall Street Journal, and Politico, reported that Trump planned to vote in person at an early voting site, further supporting the claim that he did not vote twice.
Social media posts and fact: checking efforts: Social media posts suggesting that Trump voted twice were flagged by Facebook as part of their efforts to combat false news and misinformation. These posts included links to news reports about Trump voting both by mail and in person, providing additional evidence to verify the claim.
